intro: Agelaea usambarensis, commonly known as the Usambara agelaea, is a flowering plant native to the Eastern Arc Mountains of Tanzania. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within montane forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species with limited distribution.
